content:
TITLE: Setting up Rust nightly and rust-src component for vexide
DESCRIPTION: Commands to set up the Rust environment for building vexide. It switches to the nightly channel and adds the rust-src component, which are required for the project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/vexide/vexide/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
rustup override set nightly
rustup component add rust-src
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing cargo-v5 tool for building vexide projects
DESCRIPTION: Command to install cargo-v5, a custom wrapper over cargo that provides additional arguments for correctly building vexide for the VEX V5 platform.
SOURCE: https://github.com/vexide/vexide/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
cargo install cargo-v5
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building vexide project using cargo-v5
DESCRIPTION: Command to build the vexide project using cargo-v5. This builds the project in release mode for the VEX V5 platform.
SOURCE: https://github.com/vexide/vexide/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
cargo v5 build --release
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building vexide example using cargo-v5
DESCRIPTION: Command to build a specific example (in this case, 'basic') from the vexide project using cargo-v5 in release mode.
SOURCE: https://github.com/vexide/vexide/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
cargo v5 build --example basic --release
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Uploading vexide example to VEX V5 Brain
DESCRIPTION: Command to upload a built example (in this case, 'basic') to the VEX V5 Brain using cargo-v5. This is useful for testing changes made to the vexide project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/vexide/vexide/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
cargo v5 upload --example basic --release
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building vexide without cargo-v5
DESCRIPTION: Alternative command to build vexide without using cargo-v5. This directly uses cargo with specific target and build-std options.
SOURCE: https://github.com/vexide/vexide/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
cargo build --target ./armv7a-vex-v5.json -Zbuild-std=core,alloc,compiler_builtins
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Demonstrating Conventional Commit Format in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: Shows the basic structure of Conventional Commits used in the vexide project. The format includes type, optional scope, and description with optional body and footers.
SOURCE: https://github.com/vexide/vexide/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
type(OptionalScope): description

[optional body]

[optional footers]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Example of a Conventional Commit Message in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: Provides a concrete example of a proper commit message following the Conventional Commits specification, showing how to document documentation changes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/vexide/vexide/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
docs(contributing): add Acknowledgements section
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Example Changelog Update in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to properly update the project's changelog when making changes, including how to document breaking changes, deprecations, and reference pull request numbers.
SOURCE: https://github.com/vexide/vexide/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
  ## [Unreleased]

  ### Added

  ### Fixed

  ### Changed

+ * All functions in the `foo` module now
+   must be passed a Bar struct. (**Breaking change**) (#30)

  ### Removed

+ * Removed the deprecated `bar` module. Use the
+   `foo` module instead. (**Breaking change**) (#28)

  ### Deprecated

+ * The `Baz` struct is now deprecated. (#28)
```
